stood-at-distance.context: Young Miriam watches over baby Moses in the basket
stood-at-distance.hebrew: וַתֵּתַצַּב אֲחֹתוֹ מֵרָחֹק לְדֵעָה מַה־יֵּעָשֶׂה לוֹ
stood-at-distance.english: His sister stood at a distance to know what would be done to him

shall-i-call-nurse.hebrew: הַאֵלֵךְ וְקָרָאתִי לָךְ אִשָּׁה מֵינֶקֶת מִן הָעִבְרִיֹּת
shall-i-call-nurse.english: Shall I go and call a Hebrew nursing woman for you?

the-prophetess.hebrew: וַתִּקַּח מִרְיָם הַנְּבִיאָה אֲחוֹת אַהֲרֹן אֶת־הַתֹּף בְּיָדָהּ
the-prophetess.english: Miriam the prophetess, the sister of Aaron, took a timbrel in her hand

sing-to-the-lord.context: Miriam leads the women in song at the sea
sing-to-the-lord.hebrew: שִׁירוּ לַיהוָה כִּי־גָאֹה גָּאָה סוּס וְרֹכְבוֹ רָמָה בַיָּם
sing-to-the-lord.english: Sing to the LORD, for He has triumphed gloriously; the horse and his rider He has thrown into the sea

spoke-against-moses.hebrew: וַתְּדַבֵּר מִרְיָם וְאַהֲרֹן בְּמֹשֶׁה עַל־אֹדוֹת הָאִשָּׁה הַכֻּשִׁית
spoke-against-moses.english: Miriam and Aaron spoke against Moses because of the Cushite woman he had married

only-through-moses.context: The challenge to Moses's unique authority
only-through-moses.hebrew: הֲרַק אַךְ־בְּמֹשֶׁה דִּבֶּר יְהוָה הֲלֹא גַּם־בָּנוּ דִבֵּר
only-through-moses.english: Has the LORD spoken only through Moses? Has He not spoken through us also?

struck-with-leprosy.english: And behold, Miriam was leprous, white as snow

three-leaders.context: God remembers the three siblings' leadership
three-leaders.english: I sent before you Moses, Aaron, and Miriam

well-of-miriam.context: Midrash - the miraculous well followed Israel for Miriam's merit
well-of-miriam.english: The well was in the merit of Miriam
